alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:36PM CDT until March 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MCINTOSH...SOUTHEASTERN WAGONER...SOUTHWESTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 436 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Taft, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Wagoner... Fort Gibson... Okay... Porter... Oktaha... Braggs... Taft... Boynton... Council Hill... Tullahassee... Pumpkin Center... Sequoyah State Park... Keefeton... Wainwright... Summit... Jamesville... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
